req.name: q
req.description: Search query for filtering posts

req.name: limit
req.description: Maximum number of posts per page

req.name: page
req.description: Page number for pagination

302.description: Redirect to the post edit page after successful creation. This 302 response also covers the case where validation fails and the client is redirected back to the creation form, as is typical for Laravel web routes.

Location.description: URL to redirect to. Typically the edit page for the newly created post (e.g., /admin/posts/{id}/edit).

302.description: Redirect to the admin post edit page
Redirect to the admin.users.edit page for the updated user.

req.name: page
req.description: The page number to return for pagination (default is 1).

examples.text/html:
Users

List of users will be rendered here by the admin panel.

req.name: limit
req.description: Maximum number of users to return per page.

req.name: page
req.description: The page number for pagination.

200.description: Successful response. Returns the admin comments index as an HTML page.

302.description: Redirect to the media index page on successful creation of the media. Validation failures also result in a redirect back to the form with errors.

200.description: Successful HTML response rendering the media index page

302.description: Found. The resource was deleted and the client is redirected to the admin.media.index page.

404.description: Not Found. The specified media resource could not be found.

req.UserController:
show(User $user).
- The method signature shows a route parameter named {user} which is type-hinted to the User model via Laravel's route model binding. This indicates that the path includes a required parameter called user, representing a user identifier (typically the user ID).
- Since the endpoint is a GET request that returns a UserResource for the specified user, there are no query parameters used by the show method. The visible parameters for this operation are limited to the path parameter {user}.
- In Swagger 2.0, a path parameter must be described with: name, in (set to
req.name: user
user
req.description: The ID of the user to update

200.description: Rendered HTML content for the post's comments page.

req.name: post
req.description: ID of the post

req.name: limit
req.description: Pagination limit for number of comments per page

200.description: A paginated list of comments for the post

req.name: body
req.description: Payload containing updated user account information

302.description: Redirect to the account edit page after updating the user settings; in case of validation failure, a redirect back with errors is returned.
Found - redirect to the account edit page

req.name: body
req.description: Payload for updating the authenticated user's password

302.description: Redirect to the password settings page after successful update

403.description: Forbidden - the user is not authorized to update this resource

req.name: body
req.description: Payload containing the new password for the authenticated user

302.description: Redirects to the password settings page after successful password update.

403.description: Forbidden. The authenticated user is not authorized to update this password.

200.description: Successful Turbo Stream response containing HTML fragments to update the comments UI

examples.text/vnd.turbo-stream.html:
<turbo-stream action="prepend" target="comments">
  <template>New comment HTML here</template>
</turbo-stream>
<turbo-stream action="replace" target="comments_form">
  <template>Comment form HTML here</template>
</turbo-stream>
<turbo-stream action="update" target="comments_count">
  <template>Updated count here</template>
</turbo-stream>

200.description: Turbo Stream response containing actions to remove the deleted comment and update the comments count.

401.description: Unauthorized. Authentication is required to delete a comment.

403.description: Forbidden. The authenticated user does not have permission to delete this comment.

404.description: Not Found. The specified comment does not exist.

200.description: Turbo Stream response containing the updates for the like UI (like button and likes count).

req.name: email
req.description: Email address to subscribe to newsletter

302.description: Redirects back to the previous page with a success flash message stored in the session.

req.name: post
req.description: ID of the Post to update

200.description: Successful deletion of like(s) for the post by the authenticated user.

req.name: image
req.description: Image file to attach to the media item

req.name: name
req.description: Optional name for the media item. If provided, this will be used as the media name.

req.name: media
req.description: ID of the Media resource to delete
